intro: Corydalis chelidonium, commonly known as the yellow corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a lanceolate shape with a hairy texture. Corydalis chelidonium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
